Class NamedColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • NamedColor

  • public class NamedColor
extends java.lang.Object
    The class NamedColor defines a set of basic colors for shape painting. It is not defined as enum to allow users to arbitrarily add colors of their own.
    Version:
    1.01.4240 — 2012-10-13
    Author:
    Rudolf PECINOVSKÝ

      Opens a dialog box with all defined names separated by commas.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the name of the color.
      NamedColor translucent()
      Returns translucent version of the color, which means a color with the same color components and alpha value 0.5.

      • getAwtColor

        public java.awt.Color getAwtColor()
        Converts the NamedColor to type used by the painter. This method is used in the class Canvas.
        Returns:
        Instance of Color representing the given color

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the internal index of the color.
        Returns:
        Index of the color

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the color.
        Returns:
        The name of the color

      • getNamedColor

        public static NamedColor getNamedColor(int red,
                                       int green,
                                       int blue,
                                       int alpha)
        Returns color with given values of its components and translucency. If the color is not yet defined, creates it and assigns it a generic name according to its component values.
        Parameters:
        red - The red component
        green - The green component
        blue - The blue component
        alpha - The alpha component = transparency level 0=transparent, 255=opaque
        Returns:
        NamedColor with given values of its components

      • getNamedColor

        public static NamedColor getNamedColor(int red,
                                       int green,
                                       int blue,
                                       int alpha,
                                       java.lang.String colorName)
        Returns color with given values of its color components, transparency and given name. If the color is not yet defined, creates it. If the color with given name exist and has another values of components or if the color with given values of components exists and has another name, the IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        red - The red component
        green - The green component
        blue - The blue component
        alpha - The alpha component = transparency level 0=transparent, 255=opaque
        colorName - Name of asked color
        Returns:
        NamedColor with given name and values of its components
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the color with given name exist but has another values of components or if the color with given values of components exists but has another name. Or if the name is empty.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the name is null.

      • getNamedColor

        public static NamedColor getNamedColor(int red,
                                       int green,
                                       int blue,
                                       java.lang.String name)
        Returns opaque color with given values of its color components and given name. If the color is not yet defined, it creates it. If the color with given name exists and has other values of components or if the color with given values of components exists and has another name, the IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        red - The red component
        green - The green component
        blue - The blue component
        name - Name of asked color
        Returns:
        NamedColor with given name and values of its components
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the color with given name exist but has another values of components or if the color with given values of components exists but has another name.

      • getNamedColor

        public static NamedColor getNamedColor(java.lang.String colorName)
        Converts the color name to its respective NamedColor instance
        Parameters:
        colorName - The name of the requested color. The list of existing names returns the method getListOfNames()
        Returns:
        Instance of NamedColor representing the given name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the color of the given name is not defined yet

      • setInUppercase

        public static boolean setInUppercase(boolean inUpperCase)
        Sets if the names should be written in uppercase.
        Parameters:
        inUpperCase - true if names should be written in uppercase, false otherwise
        Returns:
        Original setting

      • showDefinedNames

        public static void showDefinedNames()
        Opens a dialog box with all defined names separated by commas. The names are alphabetically sorted.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the name of the color.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Name of the color

      • translucent

        public NamedColor translucent()
        Returns translucent version of the color, which means a color with the same color components and alpha value 0.5.
        Returns:
        Translucent version of the color
